newsitem.title: UK: Hanson names new group finance director. [CORRECTED 12:10 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Hanson names new group finance director. [CORRECTED 12:10 GMT]

text.p: (Corrects headline and text throughout to make clear appointments will be made to the group rather than Energy Group Plc.)

Anglo-U.S. conglomerate Hanson Group said on Tuesday that Alan Murray, the current assistant finance director would be made the finance director of the group after demerger of its Energy Group Plc division due for next month.
Hanson's shareholders are scheduled to vote on the demerger proposal on February 21 which would then take effect on February 24.
Murray will be joined by Hanson's company secretary Jonathan Azis as executive directors of the group.
According to the demerger proposal Hanson shareholders would receive one share in the Energy group for every 10 existing shares in Hanson group.
Energy shares are due to commence trade on February 24 in both London and New York.
Hanson said it would also announce its first quarter results to December 31, 1996 on February 24, 1997.
